Reviews.Title: “3 night stay”
Reviews.Author: kam010
Reviews.Content: This was a nice hotel. Clean and I liked the layout of the rooms. It seems to be more of a business orientated hotel but was still very good. The station is very close and you can get around everywhere quite easily.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended if you stay in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: CrescentCity
Reviews.Content: The Oasia hotel is a new hotel in Singapore with a great club lounge on the 22th floor where you can have breakfast and eat outside with a view of the city. The hotel is located next to a shopping mall with access to the subway where you can easily go where every you want to be in Singapore. Rooms are a bit small (I think this is normal in Singapore), modern and well decorated with a mini fridge, huge HD television, great bed, a nice bathroom and even an espresso machine. The hotel staff is very nice and we felt welcomed when we arrived after a long journey from Europe. We would highly recommended this hotel if you stay in Singapore. One question to the hotel; if you book club room why do you have to use the club breakfast and not take the breakfast downstairs like any other hotel?

Reviews.Title: “Very comfy; slightly expensive but excellent location”
Reviews.Author: christineMalaysia
Reviews.Content: I loved the Oasia. I stayed there for 2 nights in a deluxe room. I found the price of the room slightly on the high side, but this is Singapore. While the room was slightly smaller than what I envisioned, the location was excellent. Oasia is located in Novena, which is 2 MRT stops away from Orchard. It is away from the hustle and bustle of the main city area and it is quiet during the nights. Oasia is also located very close (a 1 minute walk) to the drop off point of the First Coach bus service that operates between Kuala Lumpur and Singapore. Very, very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “nice bed, but weak shower, poor floorplan”
Reviews.Author: taipa
Reviews.Content: they gave me a room where the shower of the bathroom is a floor to ceiling window! wtf, so i had no choice but to lower the shades of the bathroom shower the whole time i was there, making the bathroom very dark. i have stayed in rooms with nicer floorplans in the past, but i cant help but feel like the check-in staff passed off this crappy room to me on purpose.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect New Hotel, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: bubblybenji
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a very nice new hotel. The staffs are very helpful and nice. When I arrived, the room was not yet ready, and they made me wait for about 40min. But the waiting time paid off immediately, as the receptionist informed that they upgraded my room for free as an apology..!! :D The room is not so spacy, but enough. It is in minimalist style but very comfy. A big window through out the room makes the sun comes through and gives you the nice view of novena area. The colour selection for the room is soft on the eye. The amenities inside the room are quite standard Ihairdryer, coffee, fridge, etc..), but I have to mention as a coffee lover that they provide the espresso machine..!! The room, including the bathroom is spotless. The only thing I miss in the room is a full-body mirror, somehow I need it :) This is another plus point for this hotel: you walk have 5min to the Novena MRT. The MRT station's just accross the road. And when it's raining, there is a connecting way via the Novena medicalcenter that opens 24hr. This is very helpful. The hotel is just besides the Novena square, you can grab anything easily from there if you like. I'd definitely stay in this hotel again next time I'm in Spore.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location!!!”
Reviews.Author: Travella24
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 weeks due my medical condition. The hotel is conveniently located in the big hospitals like TTS, Novena Medical Center, Thomson Medical Clinic. In short its an Oasis in the middle of the medical hub of Singapore. For the last three weeks of staying in Oasia, I feel more relaxed and contented. Food is always good at the Living Room club, Fresh apples in front of the elevator (club rooms) and the staff were very friendly and hospitable.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: ngjeff
Reviews.Content: Just back from staying there for 3d1n. Everything was so fantastic except for the only minor defect, which is we would have to pay if using Wifi. We then went to the Novena Square just next to the hotel to get the free access to wifi. The room was so comfy and modern. The bathroom was well-equipped with a warm decoration. The bed was big. We were greatly impressed by the hospitality of the staff. I won't hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone who would like to find a reasonably-priced accommodation in SG next to the heart of the city.

Reviews.Title: “3 Days of Bliss”
Reviews.Author: RWWNSW
Reviews.Content: Three days at the Oasia Hotel in Singapore was definitely money well spent. What a fantastic hotel and what I am sure, is a bit of a hidden treasure. We opted to pay that little bit more for a club room (AUD) $758 for three nights which gave you access to the “lounge” a functional space on the 22nd floor where the you can enjoy a peaceful breakfast looking over the city, complimentary coffee or drink throughout the day and a great place to start of your evening with drinks and snacks. Oh, and we can’t forget to mention the expansive pool area on the 22nd floor, which is sleek in its design and an oasis from the hustle and bustle of Singapore. The room was contemporary, well furnished and a pleasure to be in. Watch out for the refreshing smells as you enter the lifts, there’re like moving spas. Had a walk around the main pool and gym which was also very impressive. Only two MTR stops to Orchard Road, maybe this ever so slight distance from the major areas gets that extra bang for your buck! Highly recommended and this is one hotel we will revisit.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay at Oasia hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Ranjan_Jha
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Oasia hotel for 2 nights. It was an unbelievable experience, not only in terms of the rich boutique oriental design of the hotel interiors but also in terms of good service and excellent location. The Club floors with its own open-air lounge and sauna was a relaxing sight; it was so breezy at all times of the day. Well done!

Reviews.Title: “Brand new, great club rooms”
Reviews.Author: jcn_uk
Reviews.Content: The Oasia is a new hotel, located in Novena. Novena is a great neighborhood close to Newton (one stop on the red (north-south) metro line) and Orchard road (two stops). In other words, you are very close to the hawker centre in Newton Circus, and all the shopping on Orchard Road. If that was not enough, the hotel itself is on top of a mall (Novena Square). The hotel is new, chick, with two nice pools: one large one for general consumption, and one smaller indoor one for club level guests. The rooms at the club level are a good deal (specially if you book early and get a discount). They include wifi, mini-bar, breakfast, and a cocktail hour at 6pm. They also feature a cool 46" TV and an even cooler Nespresso coffee machine. The club rooms are on the small size, so the 46" TV feels like a movie screen. The view from the rooms are incredible (towering over Singapore), and the bathroom as one of the best showers I have seen in a hotel) Not much more to add. The pictures (and small video) on their website are perfectly fair (did not even bother to add mine). The service is ok, although the breakfast tends to be busy, and they run out of things some times. But since this is a club level breakfast (not a full restaurant one), people are patient enough, and the staff try very hard to get all done for you. All and all, for the right price, this is a good option for Singapore. I would definitely consider it again for my annual trip to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: cuisinera
Reviews.Content: Took a short trip to Singapore and stayed here for 3 days. Oasia Hotel is beautiful inside and out. The rooms are fairly big enough, complete with all amenities. Bathrooms are my pet peeve when staying in hotels and I was very pleased that our bathroom was very clean. The bed was so comfy. Pillows were perfect! Staff are very helpful. They wrote down addresses of the hawkers, restaurants and shops we wanted to visit. I wanted to leave a shopping bag in the concierge since I had to run back out again to get something and they offered to bring it up to the room. There's a small shopping mall beside the hotel with lots of small restos and food shops. They had a Starbucks too so coffee was easy access in the morning. If you need to take the MRT, the station is inside the mall. Novena is 2 stops away from Orchard Road. The MRT is on time and prompt so this made it very convenient for us to go around Singapore. Love this hotel! Would stay here again definitely!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location to get around S'Pore”
Reviews.Author: Liz H
Reviews.Content: Good hotel, clean & tidy and very friendly staff both at the desk and on the doors. Excellent location as right next door to MRT and some good food places also.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, Modern Hotel”
Reviews.Author: joy101
Reviews.Content: We booked this trip via Agoda and got a standard room for around 140 usd/night (plus taxes). Got upgraded to a deluxe room, which was nice. It's slightly bigger than the standard room with a balcony and a modern bathroom. This was also in the 9th floor, overlooking the pool. Pros: - Right beside Novena square with lots of eateries, shops, and the office tower.. and most importantly the MRT (novena station) - New hotel; modern design; very clean - Good service; courteous staff Cons: - On our last night, the fire alarm rang at around 5AM. It was helpful they had announcements so we more or less knew what was going on (we were told to stay calm and wait for further announcements).. It turned out to be a false alarm. Still not a good way to wake up. - No free internet

Reviews.Title: “Good rooms & access; Some improvements needed”
Reviews.Author: mjcSING
Reviews.Content: Overall this was a postive experience. The rooms are clean, modern, and relaxing. The bed is excellent. Access to MRT couldn't be better, giving easy access to Orchard Road to satisfy one's shopping desires. Staff were friendly enough, but didn't seem as 'on task' as they could be. Check in and check out seemed to take longer than most similar hotels, and there wasn't much sense of being a 'valued guest'. Breakfast was of good quality, but there isn't much on offer. The aunties from the restaurant had trouble keeping up with demand and there was a wait for plates and food. There are a number of breakfast options at the mall above the MRT station. Still, I'd come back here. There rooms are nice and new. I trust management will invest in upgrading their hotel experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, great extras, good value”
Reviews.Author: sarahc40
Reviews.Content: New hotel over the road from TTSH hospital, directly next to the large Novena mall, 1 min from the MRT station (Novena) and a few minutes walk from some great local eateries (especially 2nd mini steamboat delight). Around SGD300/night for 2 people in a king club room with free minibar replenished daily (soft drinks and a couple of beers), good breakfast (cooked, egg station, or continental), all day espresso/drinks, 6 p.m. coctails and nibbles included (for 2 hrs) in the club lounge. Private lap pool for club guests at lounge as well as larger pool etc open to all hotel guests. The rooms are clean, beds comfortable, though rooms are small by western standards (I think this is generic in Singapore). Nice toiletries and all that you would expect in the room. Espresso machine in the room. Free wireless with club rooms. We had a really great stay. The breakfast and nibbles/drinks were well worth it and certainly would highly recommend paying the bit extra for this. The staff were really friendly and able to help with our travels. It was a mixed business/holiday trip. Transport is cheap in Singapore so don't be put off by the location being a little out of central city. Really great if you need to be in the hospital district.

Reviews.Title: “Oasia Hotel Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Monihart
Reviews.Content: It is a the perfect Hotel to visit Singapore.The hotel is near by a MRT Station. With the MRT you can very easy reach all the Singapore sights. The Hotel has follow pools: One in the 8. floor with a children pool, and one in the 22. floor. with a jacuzzi. We have booked an executive-room. This booking included free breakfast, free minibar and water, Nespresso-Machine with tabs at the room, and free Cocktail from 16:00 to 20:00 o`clock. The breakfast and the cocktail were every day varied, and always very very delicious and good. All the employees were very friendly, nice, helpful and cheerful. They were never tired to answer our questions and have always a good advice for us. The Oasia Hotel is a great location with a good overlooking, and it was a great experience to stay here. Thank you all the staff of the executive lounge !!! The Oasia Hotel is recommend really !!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel-Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Rosita
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights in Oasia mid-January. We were only spending a couple of days in Singapore before starting our 6 week trip of SE Asia selected Oasia because of the wonderful TA Reviews it received, plus the non-refundable special pricing made it very affordable and great value for money. Our flight from Toronto, via Tokyo, didn`t land till 1am and it was a couple of hours before we reached our hotel, checked in and were shown to the room. We didn`t use the hotel`s transportation, but there was no problem getting a taxi at the airport at that time of night and once we mentioned Novena, the driver found it easily. Even though we didn`t arrive till very late, the Reception Staff made check in a breeze. We loved our room, it was very modern, spotlessly clean and wonderful, comfortable bed. The location was perfect - only 2 subway stops to Orchard Road, Chinatown wasn`t too far and the subway was super efficient and very easy to use. We didn`t eat breakfast at the hotel; there was a lovely little cafe in the mall across the street - actually, there were lots of really nice places to eat in that mall - we really enjoyed it and picked up drinks and snacks for the room. We ran into a couple of minor problems, which were a little irritating, they weren`t a big deal. They were to do with housekeeping and they may not have been a problem if the person who showed us to our room had pointed out that the switch by the door, which wasn`t labelled, activated the `do not disturb` sign! As the lightswitches didn`t seem to correspond to the lights we were using, we were just clicking things on and off and hoping for the best. Remember it was now about 3.30am and we`d been travelling for over 24 hours!! So, the next afternoon, returning after a day of touring, we came back to find that our room hadn`t been made up. Called reception, who said they would deal with it - we went out for dinner later and at 11pm room still wasn`t made up. Called reception again, who informed us that someone had come to make up the room, but the do not disturb light was on!!! If we had only known!!! After that, we checked very carefully! As others have mentioned, it seems a little ridiculous to have to pay for WiFi - we miraculously lived without it for 3 days!!! These are just minor quibbles and if we ever go back to Singapore, we would happily stay there again and recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Nice modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: ai922
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel because of of its convenient location for my business trip. There's no shortage of places to shop and eat around the hotel as ist is adjacent to a mall complex. Getting around is also easy because it's right on the Novena MRT station. The hotel is very new and modern, so for those whose taste is comtemporary, they will find this hotel pleasing. Huge windows cover almost an entire wall for a bright airy feel to the room. Bed is comfortable w/ down pillow top and comforter, a bit too warm for Singapore's weather but nice and cozy. The hotel charges about S$20 extra per day for internet. Would be a plus to include that in their standard room rate. The 8th floor pool deck is nice. They just need to vacuum the pool more frequently. All in all, this hotel is very good if you prefer a new facility.

Reviews.Title: “Oasia Hotel - King Suite”
Reviews.Author: Hello_Kitty1977
Reviews.Content: The room has some funny smell and suspect could be the wooden walls (maybe they are very new). Breakfast is ok not much choices. The room is comfy and cosy, the staffs are friendly. The hotel provide us a bottle red wine as we are celebrating 8th wedding anniversary, NICE!! Overall is a nice place to stay as Shopping mall, food mall, MRT just next door.

Reviews.Title: “Wohoo...Fantastic stay with Oasia!”
Reviews.Author: YLChua
Reviews.Content: I had a 3D2N stay with my wife in Oasia and the experience was more than I expected! The Club Suite is just as what you see from the picture. Nice deco, get scenic view, spacious rooms with state-of-the-art lighting control mechanism. Anyone who books into a club suite room should try out have a relaxing bath soaking in the stone bathtube - my wife's favourite. Brings back memories of our time where we had hot spring bath in Taiwan! =) The Club lounge was another commendable point of Oasia hotel. The lounge had great view, constantly having light snacks, fruits and drinks available for Club room guest to enjoy on 24hrs. The staff managing the lounge was friendly and helpful. One of the staff there even remembers me and chatted up with me and my wife which gives us a great sense of feeling as if being at home. The exclusive club pool was just as nice, located just next to the lounge. A great place to chill out and fun to have a swim at high floor. Location of the hotel is strategic too. Conveniently just next to Novena shopping center and Novena mrt where you can catch a train to Orchard area for more shopping. And if you are a fan of local food, you can easily either walk over to Novena Ville for wide variety or take a bus down to Balestier Rd/Whampoa Market for some popular tasty food!! An overall wonderful experience during the short stay and I am already planning for a 2nd visit soon! *wink*

Reviews.Title: “wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: nina n
Reviews.Content: I had friends you stayed in the hotel for several occassion and as my family plan to celebrate my younger sister's birthday away from home, we have decided to choose Oasia Hotel as it is near to our house, indeed very convenient to the train station too. When we first arrive we were welcome by the Guest Service staff who opened the door and assist with our luggage. Check-in was smooth, another Front Desk agent(a guy) played with my younger brother and gave him a little souvenir. That perfect start leads us to experiencing a true service from the heart, my family felt welcome. The room was fantastic, we got the corner room which is our Favourite by the way. When we open the door, we all went "WAHH WAHH WOWWW". Not disapointed at all. We enjoyed the pool, steam room and sauna. We had several calls to send up more toothbrush and blankets as we do not like sharing, it arrive minutes after calling. Impressive! But there is only 2 cons: Before we booked, i asked the reservation agent which room has bath tub. She assured me that the Superior room has bath tub. So i booked that. very disappointing, no bathtub we felt cheated. Secondly, when we flip over the duvet, THERE WAS A HUGE BLOOD stain. Totally disgusted. Called and got them to change it immediately. Overall, i enjoyed the stay with my family however i hope the management can look into careful details in terms of room condition.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant surprise!”
Reviews.Author: Aly Z
Reviews.Content: We have been in Singapore several times before and stayed in most 5 and 4 star hotels. When our daughter booked us in to this hotel we did not know what to expect. The first encounter with the guest rooms was lukewarm because we were used to staying in bigger rooms before. But we found that the extraordinary artistic design made all the difference. The size of the rooms did not matter. Every little thing was well conceived at every space, rooms-lounge-reception-restaurants-gym et al. The height was very cleverly used to give a sense of space. The food both in the restaurants and in the room service was good. The use of stone cuts, granite, the wood-cut sculptures in every room was unique. The staff were very courteous and welcoming. Sara and Aly Zaker & family. Dhaka , Bangladesh

Reviews.Title: “fresh clean modern hotel with MRT across the street”
Reviews.Author: alexbdv
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very new so the rooms still have a new feel to them and are really modern and pretty spacious with a nice comfortable bed. Enjoyed a corner room on the 10th floor that had a great view. Good sized LED tv and roofpool on 8th floor. Very conveniently situated across a shopping mall with in the basement of this mall the MRT station Novena which can take you across the whole city. Since the hotel is pretty big i did miss the personal touch, actually there was only interaction with staff during checking in and checking out. - have read some reviews about the fire alarm that went off... unfortunately we also experienced this one late afternoon. - no free WIFI ?? u kidding me? this is 2012!!! specially for the room prices this should be free

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed in Singapore.”
Reviews.Author: Nursingirl
Reviews.Content: We were told this was a fairly new hotel in Singapore. However, the carpeting in the restaurant looked like it hadn't been cleaned in a very long time, not very appetizing. Taxi drivers were unfamiliar with the hotel, it was a challenge returning to hotel. Be sure to take a card from reception with the address. Rooms were not cleaned until late afternoon. Breakfast was terrible, the only good part was my latte. I was very disappointed in our choice of hotel, next time we visit Singapore I will do my research.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel but staff need training!!”
Reviews.Author: cckc123
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with 5 colleagues for a week in January on business. It was a very new hotel, everything looked clean and fresh and contemporary. The rooms were of reasonable sizes and a spacious bathroom with all the amenities you may need. It is perfectly located right next to a shopping mall with the MRT station underneath. Across from the shopping mall, there was a street full of good restaurants (as recommended by local colleagues) of different cuisines. The breakfast buffet was OK but with very limited choices and all the hot dishes were not hot, just warm. Because of the tour groups and the businessmen staying in this hotel, it was always packed with people and the restaurant was so small that you couldn’t find a seat even at 7am. When we checked in at the hotel, we were caught into some problems with our booking (won't go into details), the ladies at the reception desk didn’t want to help and didn’t really care, so we have to gone thru lots of trouble to get things fixed. Not just the reception desk, the staff at the restaurant were also very inexperienced, one of the staff at the waffle machine was trying to make waffles for half an hour but still didn’t get it right. I have also tried to call for wait-up call for 4 nights and EVERY NIGHT I had to call 5 – 10 times in 2 – 3 hours in order for someone to answer my call, I have tried to call the concierge, the front desk, and the bell counter, but NO ONE ever answered my call; the same thing happened to my colleagues too. All in all, you can tell that the staff at this hotel were not too experienced and professional and not even willing to help; definitely need more training !

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay At Oasia”
Reviews.Author: ErtanS
Reviews.Content: I've stayed five nights at Oasia. The location of the hotel was very good, just upon the Novena subway station, 10 minutes to Orchard Road. The immediate area is very safe. I've stayed in a superior room. Designed with very modern objects the room was spacious enough for Singapore conditions. The room has a wide screen tv with over 30 satellite channels and an ipod dock system. The hotel and the room was very clean. The pool and sports facilities were good. The personnel was very helpful and kind. The only problem with the hotel was the noises from the corridor. (the voices of people and noises of shutting doors comes inside the room very much) Overall I liked the room design, cleanliness, location and personnel behaviours of the hotel and may stay here on my next Singapore visit.

Reviews.Title: “Comical. Bumbling. Fire Alarm.”
Reviews.Author: stoneman60
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here one night before moving into our new condo next door. I'm sure if you stay here you'll be able to guess which condo it is. Our thought was we should check it out to decide whether we should guests who visit us in Singapore there. Good: - Clean rooms - Near hospital (this place gets a lot of medical tourists) - On top of Novena MRT (this can go either way - personally I'd stay closer to city if I was visiting as a tourist) - Nice pool. Not to crowded. There are usually chairs available. (I see it everyday from my condo) Bad: - Service: Singapore is not the most customer driven place to begin with... but this place took it to a whole new level. The vibe I got was nobody was in charge or knew what to do. Kinda lame. - Fire alarm: This place has a problem with its fire alarm system - ie. it goes off often. I stayed here 1-night in December. The alarm went off at 3am. I asked an employee about it. He rolled his eyes and said "after heavy rain, the alarms get shorted". I interpret this as poor electrical work, dripping water and moisture triggers the alarms. In Singapore it rains a lot. - Everything is OK Alarm: I believe Homer invented this on an episode of the Simpsons. Basically its an alarm that goes off to tell you everything is OK. The Oasia thought this was a good idea. After the 3am alarm finally gets turned off, just as you're about to fall asleep, the "everything is OK alarm" goes off. It is just as loud as the fire alarm. Brilliant! UPDATE So I've been living next to this hotel for 2-months now and they haven't fixed the alarms yet. I hear the fire alarm get triggered about twice a week - often late at night. The Oasia still annoys me on a bi-weekly basis with their stupid fire alarms. I can only imagine how the guest who stay there feel. Especially the poor couple who got married there last night. Keep up the good work guys ;-)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: LoveSEAsia35805
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Oasia for two nights in late July 2011. The hotel/room provided great comfort after my 27 hour journey from Chicago. The hotel had only opened a few months earlier but one would never know it. The service was great. The staff was very professional, respectful and caring. They really had their act together. The buffet breakfast in the hotel was plentiful with both western and asian choices. The room was a bit small but that's to be expected in hotels in Asia. There were no cabinets to place clothes which meant i had to "live" out of my suitcase. But for two nights it didn't matter much. The location was very good being next to a medium size shopping mall and easy access to the Novena MRT station. Its easy to navigate around Singapore staying at this hotel. I was also able to travel to Changi airport by MRT door to door within one hour. The room rates are very reasonable compared to what you might pay in the hotels in the Orchard Rd. area. I would definitely stay here again and likely will when I travel to Singapore again in 2013.

Reviews.Title: “overall excellent”
Reviews.Author: Ex-LA
Reviews.Content: Oasia Hotel is relatively new; it is connected to the Novena Medical Center and Ten Tock Seng Hospital, the former of which is catering to the Medical Tourism trade. The hotel is about 100 feet from the Novena MRT (subway) station on the red line (north-south line). (by the way, the MRT system is very impressive: easy to use, cheap, and efficient. It is pretty crowded during rush hour, however.) There is, by US standards, a massive indoor mall right next door to the hotel (by Singaporean standards, it is just another mall!) with grocery stores, a ton of restaurants, shops, etc. No hawker stalls nearby, but if you go one stop on the MRT to the Newton station, there is the Newton Food Center across the street which has excellent hawker stalls and is very cheap. The hotel room I had was on the 13 floor: a little bit small by US standards, it was comfortable nevertheless. The room was clean and relatively quiet. I had two twin beds (not by request) and they were pretty comfortable. The bathroom is fine: walk in shower, no tub, and the basic amenities. They offer a massive breakfast buffet that came with my room rate featuring waffles, eggs, vegetable curry (yum!), bacon, sausage, and pretty much anything else you could want. It gets very crowded and you end up sharing tables. Wifi is NOT free ($22 SGD daily). At least the connection had pretty good speed. There are a few English-speaking channels on the flatscreen TV (ESPN, CNN, BBC, Bloomberg). On the 8th floor, there is a workout room with a few barbells, treadmills, and a bike. Not much to speak of, but enough to break a sweat. There's a very nice pooldeck with a small kids pool and a jacuzzi. There's no poolside service that I saw, however. Osaia is not a resort hotel. There is no concierge, at least not for the non-club patrons like me. The front desk folks try to be helpful though. It is more along the lines of a business hotel: well located, clean, convenient, and efficient. There were a ton of people staying here that seemed to be part of an organized group travel operation, I think. If that's the sort of place you're looking for, I think this is a very good hotel to stay in. However, if you're a first time visitor to Singapore and you anticipate needing a lot of help with travel/touring/dining plans, you might want to consider staying at a more "full service" (read: expensive) hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place. Great Service.”
Reviews.Author: Brian H
Reviews.Content: I was just here for a week in a club room; I think it is great and the staff was exceptionally friendly and helpful. Arriving in the evening, I was escorted directly to the club lounge to check in. Afterwards, I was encouraged to stay and have a drink while my luggage was taken to my room, which I was happy to do. My room on the 21st floor was small, but very nice, with a minimalistic Asian-zen vibe, good view over the city and a fantastic bathroom with rain shower and Thann bath stuff. There was a ton of extras included with the club room; breakfast, suit pressing and evening cocktails/hors d'oeuvres. It didn't seem as if internet was included, so each day I bought another 24-hour package...I think it was around SGD 25. I was in SIngapore to find a place to live, so in the evenings I would come back from house (er...tiny, non-descript condo) hunting and relax in the lounge. After my second visit, the staff remembered my drink preference (2 G&T's, followed by red wine) and were politely curious as to how my day had gone, where I had been looking at places to live and had helpful comments on all the neighborhoods I had been visiting. The very sweet maid quickly learned my schedule, and every morning when I went to the lounge for breakfast, she would clean my room and have it ready by the time I got back. Speaking of breakfast, there was a changing variety of Asian and Western options each morning, and there was always very good pastry, bread, cheese, and smoked salmon. Evening hors d'oeuvres were varied as well; crackers, cheese, salsa and chips were constant. Overall, the food wasn't exceptional but it was more than acceptable and I skipped dinner altogether on several occasions because there was a lot of it. The hotel location is quite convenient, with an MRT right alongside, as well as a shopping mall with a ton of stores and restaurants. At check out, I was pleasantly surprised to find out that internet was included in the room rate, as well as the mini-bar and I was escorted downstairs to a waiting taxi and thanked profusely for my business. All in all, a great stay and great value.

Reviews.Title: “Nice New Hotel”
Reviews.Author: amourshelly
Reviews.Content: It's located near Orchard Road, besides a mall and MRT Station. Nice room and I love the bathroom since the first thing I will check on a hotel is always the bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Great new hotel.”
Reviews.Author: roycie83
Reviews.Content: Having only opened in April 2011, this hotel is a great new hotel to stay at. In my opinion, the best hotel I stayed at so far in Singapore, has been the Conrad hotel. Oasis, takes the runner up place. Location is great as there is a mall next door. If you take MRT, there is a station right in front of the hotel. Overall, the price is rather cheap for such a nice hotel. One thing though, because it is a new hotel, I have been given inaccurate info by the staff at least 3 times. So make sure to reconfirm what you have been told by the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: mick_dav
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel as the first stop on our honeymoon. Everything was fantastic from the moment that we checked in past midnight and were greeted with lovely smiles. Breakfast was delicious with a great variety. Our room was spotless and very comfortable. Pool and outside area is so nice, so much so that you forget you are in the middle of a city. Location right next to the MRT was great...so easy to get around. We would definitely recommend this hotel and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: Turista42
Reviews.Content: This hotel is new and relatively unknown - we went for the Junior Suites which by HK prices were very reasonable In general, if you like contemporary design this place is for you The Junior Suites came with access to the Club on 22nd floor with complimentary food, cocktails, breakfast and a super cool pool with a constant cooling breeze (at least when we stayed) Service was excellent and the location was very convenient, right next to Novena MRT

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with easy access to public transport”
Reviews.Author: Reinhouse
Reviews.Content: The Oasia is located right next to the Novena MRT station. Very conveniently only two stops to Orchard road. The rooms are not spacious, but right in size and clean. The design is modern and very functional. The hotel lobby is great and makes you feel very good when you enter the hotel. Also the pool and the gym have a good standard and are fairly new. The staff is very friendly and the service is good. Overall I would recommend this hotel for any type of visit, leisure or business.

Reviews.Title: “Worth your money”
Reviews.Author: Rungsan_Hme
Reviews.Content: The hotel is new and very nice decor. Room is so comfortable in spite it compact size, but it has all you need. The lobby is extraordinary.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - Club room was very nice”
Reviews.Author: MarcelTirta
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on a business trip in one of the Club rooms. The room was a little small but very nicely furnished and included amenities that I haven't seen in other hotels before, like a stationery set. The location was great, right across the street from Novena MRT station and Velocity mall. Check in for the Club room was on a separate floor, which also has the swimming pool and gym as well as breakfast buffet and cocktail lounge. The free cocktails were great and included finger foods, coffee, tea and, of course, cocktails. The breakfast selection was a bit sparse but not too bad. I enjoyed my stay at this hotel very much and will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Still Working Out The Kinks”
Reviews.Author: TravelingTeacher456
Reviews.Content: The first time I stayed here, in October 2011, I had a wonderful experience. The facilities were brand new and my room was upgraded at no cost. Check-in was speedy and I was greeted by friendly staff. The pool was great, with a beautiful view. Good location, literally steps from the Novena station and cabs were always available. Seamless check-out. However, I recently stayed there again, in January 2012 and had a drastically different experience. Again, I was "upgraded" but this time, that did not turn out to be a good thing. The room was much smaller than my previous experience. The air-conditioning didn't work. Even after they came to "fix it", which involved an hour of extreme noise, we still were up the whole night, sweating. In the bathroom, several tiles were not glued down all the way, which we kept cutting our feet on. When asked to repair, we were not offered a new room and we were told by the grounds crew that it was the best they could do. In addition to the poor room quality during my second stay, the elevators were out of comission for about two hours. I was even willing to walk the TWENTY flights of stairs up to my room, but after asking a staff member where the stairs were, was very rudely told that there were none....?? I still give it a four star, but that is solely based on my first experience at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Still new, close to MRT & Novena Shopping Mall”
Reviews.Author: Esther C
Reviews.Content: We (2 adults and one 2 yr old child) stayed just one night on the 4th Dec 2011. We had booked a Standard room and on the request we had written to provide one King Bed where possible. Now, king bed was not available in standard rooms, hence the lady at Check-in upgraded us to a Deluxe room at no extra cost as it was only for 1 night. That was a plus to know that upon Check-in after a flight. I had read other reviews and said that all the rooms are same size regardless Standard, Deluxe or Club room, hence did not expect the room to be big. Indeed, the room is not big. The bathroom is separated by a glass, and the toilet is separated again from the shower by a glass. I suspect the bathroom is what makes all the room types different. We found the bathroom to be quite spacious as a result. As the hotel is still new, the room was clean, furniture still new. I found the bed strangely soft for my liking, it was sort of sinking in the middle. I would have expected a firm, new bed for a new hotel. Not sure if it was the mattress protector. We had a view to the pool and it looked nice. It rained while we were there so the pool was closed. What was surprising was that....there was no NIGHT LIGHT!! I was sure because I searched all over and so did hubby. In the end, we just slept with no lights on. We have a 2 year old kid who is afraid of the dark. So that may be something to consider. Under the side of the bed I found a business card. Apparently it looks like housekeeping had missed cleaning under the bed. The restaurant for buffet breakfast downstairs is indeed small and cramped according to other reviews. It had a fair selection for breakfast. Novena Square shopping mall is right next door and so is the MRT station. Overall a good stay as the hotel is still new, and we may try the Club Room or a Suite the next time if they allow kids. Would be interesting to see how well their Club Lounge is and the benefits they provide.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel ruined by one phone call”
Reviews.Author: damiancarvill
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Oasia just for one night on our way home from Indonesia. First impressions were great, very professional check-in and attentive, friendly staff. Location-wise, it's not near any major attractions but is a short walk from the MRT and a shopping centre (isn't everywhere in Singapore a short walk from a shopping centre?!). The room is fairly small, but that's not unexpected for Singapore. The room itself has been done out really well considering its size - lovely big and comfortable bed, an ultra thin LCD TV and the bathroom has a quirky, space-saving design that worked very well. Only negative here was that the drain in the bathroom was a bit smelly, but nothing that really upset us. We spent an hour at the pool in the late afternoon and this is a really nice part of the hotel. There's a plunge pull and jacuzzi as well as the pool and some of the sun loungers are in shallow areas of the pool, which was a nice touch. That night, we ordered room service and the food was reasonably priced and a decent quality. At the same time we asked for two glasses of wine and it turned out that buying the whole bottle was the same price, weirdly. Not long later, we went to sleep and so far, so good. Then at 1am the phone rang and my wife answered. A man on the other end said: "Is this [my wife's first name]?" As she was understandably a bit sleepy, she asked him to repeat himself, before she said yes. At this point he hung up. Obviously, this completely freaked her out. I phoned reception to ask them what this could have been - they said they would get back to me. Ten minutes later and with no return call, I phoned again to be told that it was an internal call but that they didn't know who had made it. My wife couldn't get back to sleep after this and with a 16 hour journey home the next morning, we were pretty annoyed. This ruined our experience of the hotel and is why I've rated it as three instead of four out of five.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Stay”
Reviews.Author: Ashish1485
Reviews.Content: My Stay at the Oasia Hotel was very comfortable. The Service was very good and the room, although small, was good.The Hotel is just 2 MRT stations from Orchard Street. The staff is courteous and helpful. Only downside in my opinion is no complementary internet. Also the broadband charge is on a higher side. Recommended if you get a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Pricey but convenient”
Reviews.Author: Wanderella
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the executive floor of this hotel for four nights. The first thing I noticed that for an executive room, our space was a wee bit cramped even in the bathroom. I had to maneuver my medium-sized luggage under the desk so it won't be on the way. Meanwhile, the toilet is located right behind the door so if you forgot to lock it someone could walk in and easily hit you with the glass door. I loved their Thann toiletries and I shamelessly hoarded what was left of it. I guess they were aiming for Japanese minimalism with the decor. It was tasteful and functional. I enjoyed my wonderful nespresso machine. I loved how the television gave an update of the bill and if there was any messages left for me. The wifi, as mentioned, is not free. But it was fast and I never had any connection problems with it at the duration of my stay. I took my breakfasts at the 22nd floor. They had a limited selection for breakfast but it was okay because they always had croissant, smoked salmon, greens and cream cheese. I made a sandwich every morning! Their attendants always asked what I wanted for drinks. I've always enjoyed their coffee. The executive lounge is probably what won me over. It's open 24 hours. They have a free wine and cocktails every 6-9pm. And at night, if you feel hungry, you can go downstairs to open the pantry to take any cup noodles, cookies, juice, or canned softdrinks. I always did a midnight raid to get my cappuccino and Loacker wafers. They also have a private pool at the 22nd floor. I think for the price they were asking, their rooms could be better. But I guess the hotel is very convenient. It's walking distance from MRT-Novena and a shopping mall is right behind it. Building in front of the hotel is an upscale hospital (I heard the most expensive in Singapore, yet). Oh, and as I was on the 25th floor, I had the most awesome view of Singapore every morning. That one is priceless.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible stay! Fire drill went off twice in one night at 2am!”
Reviews.Author: Sushii_90
Reviews.Content: I decided to stay at this hotel because at the time of booking it was a new hotel with good reviews #22 on tripadvisor. Since then it has obviously plunged in ratings and I am not surprised. I stayed at many hotels and their standard of service is not what you will get if you paid elsewhere. No welcoming as you enter through the doors or hello. One thing that I did love about the hotel was the location! So close to a MRT stop. Food was not great at the hotel, buffet was roughly $45sgd and seriously not worth it! Not surprised when the restaurant was empty at dinner. Housekeeping was poor, some items had not been stocked up like toiletries. The worst part of my stay would have to be when a fire evacuation drill went off in the entire hotel at 2am in the morning. There was extremely loud oriental music playing whilst instructions were being announced which in the end we could not hear because of the music. In instances like this everyone reacts to a drill and heads down the stairs, 22 levels! As we got down there everyone was confused as to what was happening. There was no protocol or instructions. I went to the desk to find out what was happening and they had advised it was a false alarm. I would have not known if I didn't go to the desk. The same thing happened later that night or morning which is frustrating if you need to get up early. I will not stay at this hotel ever again!

Reviews.Title: “excellent room & Funky mohawk bellman”
Reviews.Author: voncallen
Reviews.Content: my company book me a hotel in novena where i never heard of oasia hotel. had a stay of 4 nights and was greated by one of the bellman with stylish hair handsome young chap and was directed to the reception. Check in is quite slow and no smile from the reception. Next morning i was really late for my meeting but the funky mohawk bellman rendered his assistance to get me a taxi and he ran all the way out (like a man with a mission) and got me a taxi. the room is great but sound proofing is poor and was awaken @ 3am. my last two nights of my stay The concierge and mohawk Bellman serve me quite well to the place of interest in singapore and i had a very enjoyable tour. Overall no point paying for a good room but bad service but good service give a good stay along the way.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Staffs”
Reviews.Author: Upsetkualalumpur
Reviews.Content: We stay at the Oasia for three days n everyday we felt more n more at home. Firstly the rooms were so clean and everything was new.WE stay in a superior room the amenities were sufficiently comfortable n we love the view with and using the motorize blinds n sheers was awesome .... The Staffs from the Doorman to the housekeeping were very nice. they were very kind in advicing us where to eat n what to see. Esp One person call Encik Shabeer( not sure correct spelling) who guided us every part of our way on MRT , Adviced us on Universal studio, food courts and help in walking all over to get a taxi for us.....REally a nice hardworking staff....the front desk were nice in allowing us to extend our time from 6 to 7pm and also allowed a early check in when we arrived .....1200pm...really a place i will go back to and help speaking about them to my friends.....Keep it up..n Thank you..Gunabalan Gopal.......

Reviews.Title: “Nice Room but overpriced, bad service and slow internet”
Reviews.Author: ram_dlsu
Reviews.Content: I was on a business trip for Singapore last Nov. 28 to Dec. 5 and my meetings were in Novena Tower so I decided to book here since it was just beside it. Pros: 1.) Convenient location - MRT Novena station just a couple minutes of walk and Velocity Mall is just beside it. 2.) Room was nice and comfy 3.) the Bath room was great and the Hot Shower was an awesome stress reliever. Cons: 1.) For the amount I'm paying, I expected a faster internet speed. The internet was just plain slow. 2.) They have a lot of guests and it gets packed in the restaurant between 7-9am. My problem is I have to call a waiter for them to clean up the tables left behind by the other guests. And after they clean, they don't even bother to ask if you'd like coffee or tea. You have to call them again. This was really awful. I mean Chinatown's food center cleans faster and more efficient than they do. 3.) For the price of over S$300net a night, it was just too expensive for what you're getting. Maybe if it was S$200 it might be a different story. If this hotel could improve their service, internet speed and lower their prices a bit, I think they'd be a good deal. But for my stay, they scored low for me.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and new hotel but with unfriendly receptionist”
Reviews.Author: EdwardEdie
Reviews.Content: Superb location. The room is small in size but nice, clean and comfy. It's a modern design hotel, not a luxury hotels like the other 5 stars hotels I have been. The drawback is the reception girl. I arrived the hotel with great feeling, but soon wiped off by the receptionist as I stand there. Even in this festive seasons they dont even show a bit cheerish. She was so cold, pretty but inexperienced. I'm glad that I only have to deal with them twice, during my check in and check out. I checked out early in the morning, the reception girl handed me my bill and I left. But soon I found something to ask about so I went back to her. By that time she was typing something, I can't believe my eyes that she just raised her hand to stop my sentence without raising her head to see me...and got back to me after she finished typing her stuff. I was much older than her, her manner was really not polite. I prefer her to look at me and tell me to hold on and she will get back to me soon. Oh well, this manner should be taught at home, but if the parents failed I guess it's the hotel manager's job to teach them....or simply fire them and replace with someone who can serve with heart and can bring up good ambience.

Reviews.Title: “Central, convenient, comfortable and clean - what a great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Bkworm
Reviews.Content: What a splendid place to stay!   This 4-star hotel has many pluses going for it.  We stayed in a superior room but the amenities were sufficiently comfortable and impressive.  Love the window seat and the awesome shower. Although the bathroom does not have a bath tub, the strong jets of water from the standing shower more than made up for the lack of one.  The room was clean and towels still thick and fluffy (hotel only opened for business this year).  No complaints on the general services rendered e.g front desk, housekeeping or the concierge.  In fact, I was totally impressed by one of their staff by the name of Sam who walked a distance away from the hotel entrance to help us get a cab in the middle of the night for a friend who visited us at the hotel. Talk about going the extra mile!  However, it would certainly be first class if internet wifi is provided free in the rooms instead of being chargeable, considering in this day and age where staying online is more of a necessity than a luxury. Public transportation is excellent with the Novena MRT station located just about 5 minutes' walk from the hotel.  The hotel is also within walking distance from Novena Square (shopping mall) where there's no problem getting food (no need to eat in the hotel, thus more savings) or other shopping needs. At a promotional rate of SGD180.00 per night inclusive of taxes, it was a good choice indeed. I will not hesitate to stay here again for future visits to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “For $S260 one can expect more than just a room... Poor service.”
Reviews.Author: hnrhnr25
Reviews.Content: December 5th, business trip, 1 night. I was suggested to try this hotel, as my regular hotel was fully booked. Although the location is not ideal, i figured that for 1 night it shall be OK. I arrived to the hotel just before midnight, and was greeted by the hotel reception girl. I have handed her my booking confirmation. Although she looked at it, she did not really read it, as she asked me to confirm much higher rate... When I asked her to re-check, she confirmed her mistake and I signed for the proper rate. I was given room 708, and asked for wakeup call, and taxi for my morning departure. I did notice that the girl wrote down both requests. Although it was late and the hotel was not fully booked, this reception girl handed me room for people with special needs. It means that the all bath room is built differently and to me, it reminded me geriatric hospital. In my experience, if such room is assigned to a person who did not ask for it, it shall be clearly stated before and agreed on the customer. This was not the case here, and at midnight, I had to come down asking for a room change. It seems that the girl did not even ware to her fault, or, mistake, same as she did not bother to look at my booking... Well, it needed a local manager to find normal room, which was OK. As the hotel is new, the rooms are clean, and nice. Enough lights and spacious bathroom. However to my opinion rooms are small, and may not be suitable for more than a short stay. Bed was comfortable, and working table was equipped with enough sockets (pity that only one socket is universal, all the other sockets are Singapore style). The working light is useless. 2 bottle of water. Electric sheds, and master light near the bed makes the bed experience smooth. Need to pay for internet- WHY? Now back to our reception girl.... She forgot to update my wakeup call request, luckily I had backup. When I came down by 8:15 AM and asked to verify my taxi reservation I realized that it was not done... I ws presented with the bill, guess which? The one which was mistakenly given to me upon check in. The bill which I did sign, along with the wakeup call and taxi booking, all gone with the wind, or, shall I say with the reception girl? Wonder where she has taken them...? As I had breakfast included in my rate, I stepped to the breakfast area. It looked more as busy train station, with one narrow path to guests to walk. I was seated in a table just outside the main dining area, which was OK, as it was more airy, I struggled my way into the buffet just to find out that bread was finished. OK, no bread. One of the staff brought some soft rolls, which was eatable, not more than that. Cheese selection was a mess. Fruits tray was with some leftovers, and if I had any intention to have breakfast it just evaporate with the remaining of the bread... So, I asked for tea. How wrong can it be? In Oasia or shall I say OH-ASIA hotel, you don’t get tea. You get black thick dark liquid which has weird taste, under the title TEA. So, I asked the waitress if I can get fresh tea, which has tea color and tea taste. It seems that in OH-ASIA it is not acceptable. Guests need to pay $5.00 to get FRESH TEA... If you have your breakfast paid with the room, you entitled for BAD tea. if you wish to get GOOD tea - PAY. To conclude: - New rooms do not mean good hotel - Singapore receptionist does not mean efficiency - Paid breakfast does not mean that you get breakfast, maybe some leftovers and old tea - Room rates are changeable as the weather - Need backup for wakeup (it is a rhyme!!!)

Reviews.Title: “kuch khatti kuch metthi”
Reviews.Author: meenal_11
Reviews.Content: on 3rd nov 2011,I stay there for 3 nights,over all hotel is good,the best part is its location.it is in the heart of singapore. its near novena square and is near mrt station, but the staff are not cooperative at night hours,rest every thing is ok.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Club room stay!”
Reviews.Author: Deevs
Reviews.Content: From the moment we entered the hotel, there was that aura that takes you to a different atmosphere, that refreshing scent makes you feel you're in a relaxing environment. As we asked about our reservation, we were courteously assisted by a front desk staff to the 22nd floor for our express check-in. We've got welcome drinks and cold towels to freshen up. We were allowed to check in 11am! How's that? Initially requested for a king bed since I as initially alone, but my friend decided to stay over as well so they allowed the change to a two-single bed place. The place was just magnificent! Though all their rooms were just 25sqm regardless of your category, we feel this is already adequate, and of course, coming from a hostel backpacker the previous night, this was surely a breath of fresh air. The views are nice, beds really comfy, great amenities (Thann brand), and also complimentary bar and espresso/tea making facilities. We felt we didn't really need to use the machines even the mini-bar because as Club room guests, we are also entitled to free snacks and drinks at the Living Room at the 22nd floor, all day! The private pools were nice, lots of spaces to lounge around, enjoy a drink anywhere on the floor. The views around were great as well. We went back by 730pm for the cocktails (6-8pm supposedly) and we were treated with unlimited beer, wine, and mixed drinks, and we thought their canapes were just biscuits topped with something, but no... they served chicken skewers, baked mussels, asst cheeses, veggie sticks, fresh juices and even fondue dessert! A real value for money inclusive there, wherein you'll pay $40-50, even more somewhere else. FYI: we had grilled teriyaki fish and lime chicken fillets the next day, I kinda miss those already! Since I joined the marathon that Sunday, I already got back 1130am and was really hungry so a bit worried since the complimentary breakfast ends at 11am... No problem on their part, they reopened their buffet area just for me! How's that again? Excellent service right there! The buffet is not too extensive, not too limiting either, just the right amount - no complaints! Housekeeping when we had the room serviced apparently provided the only basic toiletries - called them to ask for the Thann-brand ones, and they delivered a new set within a few minutes, with a smile, and also apologized about not providing it earlier. We also requested for more water during the night and is as then delivered right away as expected. So far, all the staff were very friendly and accommodating to us, and that's a big plus point during our stay. Check-out was a breeze, and they even allowed late check-out (2pm) as I needed to buy stuff at the adjacent malls and my flight is not until 430pm. Doreen (the Club Manager) even offered coffee and took the time to have a chit-chat with me about hotels, traveling, and the likes... Kudos to her, and to all the staff at the Club lounge (Roni, Vylemg, and the rest - sorry forgot some names!) Will definitely go back here next year!

Reviews.Title: “Modern Business Hotel in a Prime Location”
Reviews.Author: benakm
Reviews.Content: I was invited for a one night stay to try out this newly opened hotel which i gladly extended to a weekend staycation. Located in one of the prime locations of Singapore, it is very convenient as it is just about 5 to 7 mins walk away from the MRT and exactly 2 mins walking distance from the Novena Velocity Mall. Being a gym member of the California Fitness franchise, this was certainly a plus for me as I can pop over into the gym for a workout anytime of the day. The hotel was rather quiet, and the room was very clean and cozy with clear views of the surroundings (I was staying on level 19), albeit a bit small. The bed was very comfortable however I did not quite enjoy my sleep as the pillows were not to my liking, I was actually having difficulties trying to sleep on the first night. The room was equipped with rain forest showers that is a plus and the usual basic amenities. As the hotel is still quite new and unheard of by many people, I really enjoyed my swim in the guest pool as there were hardly anyone there. Needless to say, the surroundings were serene and relaxing. I have no complains on the service level of the staff. In fact it was quite good. I have made a request for more green tea packets (6 more) to be placed in the room by writing a note for the housekeeping staff (There were only 2 green tea packets. Green tea is a staple in my daily diet, 2 packets could not last me even for a day.) I was rather surprised as they have provided way more than what I asked for. Kudos and continue to keep up the good work. However, there are a couple of areas for improvements that the management may want to look at. Here's the not so good: 1) SMART TV I am not sure what was the exact problem with the TV. It can also be the connection problem. The channels (HBO | National geographic | Star Movies | Star TV | Sports | Cartoon Network) I have watched, stalled after watching for a while (About 5 mins to 10 mins before the channel will stall). It happened more than 5 times on the first night when I was watching X Factor. It was anti climax when it stalled exactly during the results release. That happened again when I was watching the finale of the Walking dead. I have to keep going back to the main channel menu to restart and re select the channel or switched the TV off and on a few times. 2) Charging for WIFI It's a bit ridiculous when I can access the free wifi services just 2 mins walking distance away. Novena Velocity Mall is providing free wifi access at no charges. i understand Wifi services is complimentary only for executive level guests but not for the other guests staying in the other room categories. Singapore is becoming an integrated media hub where Wifi services is complimentary for many places in Singapore, it has become a necessity for many people to stay connected via the internet. If it is compulsory to charge for Wifi services as part of the hotel revenue, it should be packaged into the room cost and not charged separately. People would probably choose not to pay for Wifi services when it is free next door at 2 mins walking distance away. Nevetheless, this hotel is recommended for short business travels or a short staycation as it is very near the city area.

Reviews.Title: “Brand new hotel with modern design”
Reviews.Author: gdbhinge
Reviews.Content: Oasaia hotel is located at walking distance from Novena MRT station and Velocity mall. This is new hotel with modern decor. My corner room was having good natural light due to large glass windows. It was unique that every bathroom was having large glass window overlooking buildings and roads though there was a provision to close it. The room has all the amenities including coffee machine. The breakfast was good though the space was little small and overcrowded. The price of SGD 220 + taxes inclusive of breakfast and free internet could be comparable in the locality. Overall a very good experience.

Reviews.Title: “A good four star hotel - with a few drawbacks...”
Reviews.Author: sdgt625
Reviews.Content: The best thing about the Oasia Hotel is that it is very new and clean. The rooms are very modern looking and fairly spacious. The bathrooms are fairly small, but all the furnishings inside are very nice and new. And for S$140 a night, it was the best valued four star property in Singapore I found. Here are the drawbacks - since it is a new hotel, the name is not familiar to all taxi drivers. I would say that of all the times I took cabs back to the hotel, maybe half of the taxi drivers would know the hotel. But when I mentioned that the hotel is right by the Novena mall, they all knew where to go. So, not a huge problem. Secondly, the check-in was very slow. I made a reservation under hotel.com for four guests staying in two rooms, and it took the check-in staff forever to check us in. Lastly, the biggest problem I had with the hotel is that they charge extra for everything. The cost for wifi access is S$20 for 24 hour - per device. So if I wanted wifi access for both my iphone and laptop, it would cost me S$40 a day. A little too pricy, in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place if you could get a price lower than 200 SGD”
Reviews.Author: AustinYe
Reviews.Content: Nice location, well new decorated modern design Hotel. But the room is small. And the break fast is so so. I only stay one night. So really dont have time to try the facility at the hotel. But over all, it is a good hotel, but the price over 300 SGD is totally not worth. If you can get a price lower than 200 SGD, then you could try it. It is very close the MRT station.

Reviews.Title: “Good location.”
Reviews.Author: Gerard K
Reviews.Content: It being new ensured that the rooms are all up to date - so ensuring to bring an ipod or iphone is vital wherever you are. The hotel is situated next to a mall which has a number of halal restaurants, a supermarket, a pharmacy. The shopping centre next door offers all one needs for a snack, coffee. Also has nice pool with the gym being small but efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Singapore Experience Enhanced by Oasia”
Reviews.Author: Tassiedevils_11
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Oasia from 5th to 10th November. As world travellers we research our accommodation carefully as we did with the Oasia. It is not publicised in Australia with the regular travel agents so was difficult to find. However, what a gem of a place to discover. The hotel is not too large so personal service and recognition from the happy staff is very welcoming. The minimalist design features of the room including the giant TV, the sparkling bathroom and the bed were really comfortable. We had a club room and the access to breakfast, the Club swimming pool, drinks throughout the day including cocktails and snacks in the evening was a highlight. The outstanding feature we found was the helpful, friendly and personable staff in the Club restaurant area both day and evening time. We can thoroughly recommend the Oasia for discerning travellers as it meets high standards in all areas.

Reviews.Title: “Crazy Fire Alarm & Zacko the Doorman!”
Reviews.Author: HotMama168
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Oasia for 3 nights last week with my husband. Went to Singapore to attend an art gallery opening, the Affordable Art Fair and Musee d' Orsay exhibition at Singapore Art Museum. We booked directly with the hotel. We found the rates cheaper than Agoda and their headquarters, Far East Asia. Weird. (We didn't understand why they had different rates between headquarters and hotel.) If you book now, you can get 50% off the second night. Booked a superior room. Difference between superior and deluxe rooms: The deluxe rooms are located on higher floors, have better toiletries and a Nespresso machine. Superior has a coffee maker (similar to Nespresso), but not Nespresso branded. Pros: 1. New modern hotel, with nice design. 2. Easy access to MRT, food, and low to mid end shopping. 3. Room was small but because of the glass partitions, and room layout, it didn't feel claustrophobic. 4. For a sports buff like me, being beside Velocity mall is a nice perk. 5. Robes, towels, sheets were nice and new. Not the best quality, but decent for the price. Cons/Bad experiences 1. On the first day, I asked Zacko the doorman where the concierge was because I needed help in making restaurant reservations for a dinner party I was planning. He directed me to look for the concierge in Basement 1. I was in a hurry because I was running late for an appointment, but since I needed the reservation done, I hurried to B1. I thought it was poor planning on the hotel's part to locate the concierge in the basement and not in the lobby. Anyway, upon reaching B1, it was a whole floor of conference rooms and the floor was empty! I hurried back up and talked to Zacko again. I said there was no one there and I really needed to talk to the concierge. He said, that the concierge was only downstairs or outside. Huh?! I just didn't get him. Luckily, the real concierge overheard our conversation and introduced himself. For everyone's information, the concierge is to your left upon entering hotel's doors. Clearly, this doorman doesn't know what or who their concierge was. 2. On our last night, at around midnight, we were startled when the fire alarm went off. Then loud instrumental music started playing in the overhead speakers. It seemed like it was the case in all rooms because when we stepped out and looked up and down our hall, all the other guests were getting out their rooms as well. So most of the guests in our floor, wore the robes and went down the fire escape. I managed to get my handbag and passports and went down 15 flights of steps. Upon reaching the ground level, we were worried because the alarm continued to sound. But we didn't see or smell any smoke. No hotel staff was to be seen anywhereAfter 15 minutes of not knowing what was going on, the reception staff ushered us in and said sorry for the inconvenience. When we went back up, at around 1am, the same alarm and music went off! It was crazy!!! People got mad. A man who was staying in the room down the hall started yelling angrily. Most other guests got worried and started to go down the fire escape. Again, no announcement was made by the hotel. No apology!!! We later found out from another guest that there were teenage girls who tripped the fire alarm. They knew that there was a celebrity staying at the hotel and they were hoping that the fire alarm will get them to see the celebrity. I'm not sure if this was true. But it was an extremely irritating experience. 3. On our last day, after checking out, we told Zacko the doorman (there was no one else) that we needed to get to the airport immediately. We had 2 large suitcases and 2 hand carried ones. He said to take a seat inside and he will get a cab for us. We did just that and waited patiently. But to our irritation, we saw other people walk up to the front of the hotel and got into a cab right in front of our favorite doorman! Then before I could react, Zacko gave another taxi away. I didn't get it. These people came to the front of the hotel AFTER us and obviously were not going to the airport. We should have been given priority because we got there first (and were just asked to wait inside) and was going to the airport! Overall, it's a great hotel for a base in Singapore for shopping. Because of the MTR, it can get you anywhere you want. (We found it to be a great way of getting around because we didn't have our kids with us and didn't have to navigate strollers, etc). I've stayed in other Far East Properties before and this is the first time I've had several bad experiences in one stay. I am not sure if I will choose to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel without a soul, ignorant staff”
Reviews.Author: Tia_and_Esa
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Oasia on November, Oasia being the last stop on our month-long travel. After a month of lovely 4-5 star hotels in Asia, Oasia was a big dissapointment. Our deluxe room was comfortable and clean, yet rather small. The hotel is brand new, which is a plus. However the staff is quite ignorant. The feeling you get from them is almost icy, definitely not anything close to cosy. Minimal eye contact, the feeling that you disturb them with your presence. For example upon arrival, no one offered to carry our luggage. We travel with a baby, so help would have been needed. During our stay the fire alarm broke off twice, waking us up at night. The first time we woke up, panicked, and with our hearts bumping ran down 20 floors on fire stairs with our little baby. After standing several minutes on the street with other confused hotel guests, we heard from others it was a false alarm. The staff did not inform this, or make us feel safe in any way. The second time we just calmly waited for the alarm to stop, and tried to soothe our crying baby . Needless to say, we didn't sleep that well at Oasia. Staff apologised very briefly for their technical problems, but that's all. The inexperienced staff is a problem here. Makes Oasia lack the soul it needs. Might be good for business travellers on a brief stay, otherwise I wouldn't recommend.

Reviews.Title: “If 5 star is what you're after...”
Reviews.Author: Lomunchi
Reviews.Content: This was a beautiful hotel with fine dining etc... but there was something missing. The food was excellent, but it wasn't local and didn't taste like Singapore. The location isn't ideal, there's not much to walk to near by. All the construction around the place obscures any views, but that's pretty common in Singapore. 'enjoyed, but there was nothing to love.

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable place”
Reviews.Author: AK2Borneo
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights there. The room was clean and modern, plenty of space as a business traveler. Staff friendly, only ordered room service and it came just as I ordered. Room was also the same as I reserved unlike other Singapore hotels that switch on you once you arrive.

Reviews.Title: “Simple and Clean. Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: evarocksteady
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Oasia Hotel for 3 nights and enjoyed the stay. The room isn't exactly huge but definitely bigger then Studio M and great for the price and totally livable for 2 people max! Loved the layout of the room and bathroom. Very clean and great amenities. They even had a dock with speakers for your iphone and a coffee machine with pods for a decent cup of coffee instead of the regular instant stuff. The location is brilliant. You're right next to the mall and the train station which 2 stops away from Orchard. It's central to everywhere in Singapore and easy to get cabs. Think staff could be alot more efficient and reception if I had to really pick a bone with the place. But otherwise, had a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great place with a few exceptions”
Reviews.Author: HighTide370
Reviews.Content: We just spent 5 nights here. The staff were very nice and accommodating. Arrived at 2:20 in the morning and the assistant manager showed us to our room. The room is very nice and modern with a lot of switches which aren't clearly marked. Not a big deal once you learn them. The hotel is not in the City Center but is 100 feet and 2 escalators to the MRT subway system and all attractions are 2-5 stops from this station. The escalators are in a mall which was nice to have next door as well. There's a living room, breakfast area, and rooftop pool just for Club room customers. The breakfast was good with a never ending supply of smoked salmon (my favorite) and the coffee was great. So pros: Good location. Very nice for the money. Great staff. The cons: The walls in the rooms are very thin. I don't know how someone can design a beautiful hotel and not put in sound proofing. You can hear the doors in the hall, the motorized window shades from the other rooms and I spent most of one night listening to a high pitch squeal which was the alarm clock from a room 2 doors down. The hotel was not crowded so the breakfast area was not crowded. They have 88 club rooms and seating for 20-25 for breakfast. if the hotel was full, I could see it being difficult to get breakfast. The last issue is becoming popular in a lot of hotels. There's a window between the shower and the bedroom with an electric privacy shade. The bathroom door is etched glass. There is no way to turn on the light in the bathroom without lighting up the whole room. So I really liked this place and recommend it but the sound issue is bigger for me than most and is why I can't give it 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel but not in the midst of the city center”
Reviews.Author: Zeeshan S
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 Nights this hotel, A fairly new property, looks good on the outside, the looks of the lobby is nice with the huge rock wall opposite the reception desk, the restraunt is very small and there was quite a bit of waiting for breakfast, a stones throw away from the novena station and a huge mall across the road. Rooms were spacious and the idea of the coffee machine was great. The bathing shower however didn’t have that much water force. And the pillows were quite hard. Huge windows with automatic blinders that went up and down with the push of a button but the view was of the residential bldg opposite and the pool down below. A few taxi drivers how ever didn’t know the hotel but when we said novena station/ novena mall they would get close by and from there I would guide them to the hotel as u cannot miss the huge glass building with oasia written on top. The hotel has a nice pool and gymnasium on the 8th floor.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, staff could do with being a bit more friendly”
Reviews.Author: janeyham
Reviews.Content: This is quite clearly a new hotel and is very modern and well designed. I was travelling with my 6 month old daughter so was keen to get into the room after our long flight. There were 5 receptionists serving 2 or 3 people when I arrived but I had to wait for around 20 minutes and even at that point I had to approach in a fairly forceful manner! The receptionist who served me was very efficient but she didn't smile once and used the word 'can I upsell to you....' I'm assuming she had been on training recently but in my experience they are not words used to customers, they are used by marketeers!! So on to the good stuff, I was very pleasantly surprised (this almost too away the annoyance I felt at the wait and frosty reception) to be up upgraded, I think it was to a club room and it was great, automatic blinds on the window and in the shower cubicle into the bedroom which was great for me to be able to watch the baby! On the downside they had no cot available for us and my baby had just started crawling and seemed to like attempting to throw herself off the bed. So having to have her sleep with me wasn't especially restful! I would have appreciated a heads up on that before I arrived so I could have made alternative arrangements. I loved the fact we had a bathtub in the room and also the nespresso machine was a wonderful addition. The maid was wonderfully friendly and professional and the room was spotless on arrival and also on the second day on our return. I also liked the free newspaper hanging on the door handle in the morning. The fact that you have to pay for wifi is pretty shocking in this day and age - this service should be free in every hotel, particularly those that cater for business customers. Its S$20 per 24 hours which is extortionate in my opinion but on the plus side is was fast. Location is great. Only 2 stops to Orchard Road but also if you didn't want to dine in the hotel there are many restaurants in the shopping centre just over the road. Overall I would go back to this hotel but would hope on my next visit that someone would have a little smile for me :)

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: bongkeh
Reviews.Content: For the price is there for novena area price. Its not orchard. It supposed to be a business hotel, but expensive for the internet connection, 3bucks for 15 mins. Its too much. Other than that everything is just fine.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, convinient location, super friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: JSiew
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel in October '11. Staff are well trained, friendly and helpful. Located next to Novena Square shopping complex and MRT Station. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Brief stay but Excellent Impression”
Reviews.Author: chezong
