Reviews.Content: Modern & nicely designed with proper reading lights and automated black out blinds - bigger sized room compared to other boutique hotels I've stayed at in Spore (eg: bigger than Scarlet Hotel & Innotel) . Particularly love the Thann toiletries provided - adds a touch of luxury to the room. Plus the Nespresso machine was well appreciated too! Location is extremely convenient despite having to take the train to Orchard. The walk to the MRT is mostly thru a shopping centre which means no sweating under the hot Spore sun. Whereas its sister property Quincy - althou in the city, requires a very sticky & hilly 10min walk to the shops. Oasia is highly recommended, excellent value - hoping the price doesn't increase too much. Innotel was the same price when I was booking but this place was WAY WAY more worth it. I'll definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Done in by bad service”
Reviews.Author: gloop
Reviews.Content: The room is relatively small -- regardless of whether you choose Deluxe, Superior or Club, the size is 25 sqm but with different layouts. The shower stall and WC were a bit of a squeeze compared to most other hotels'. Furnishing and fittings are still new but evidently done on a budget and doesn't look like they will stand up to eventual wear and tear. Wifi is charged on a per-device, meaning you had to pay twice if you wanted to use it on your notebook as well as your mobile. There are no views to speak of as the hotel is wedged amongst a mall, medical centre, hospitals, condominiums, office blocks and construction sites. While convenient for visiting the mall and getting to the MRT station, it oddly has no weather-proof access to these. If it rains, it's a short dash across to these adjacent facilities. Breakfast is a relatively simple buffet spread -- those expecting a cornucopia as is normal in other hotels may be a little disappointed. While the hotel is acceptable in spite of these points, what gets it a low score is the service or lack thereof. There's nothing more annoying than being ignored -- call the concierge, guest services or housekeeping, and no one answers! This happened many times in just the first 2 days of my stay. The housekeeping is also obviously poorly trained, making up the room but leaving uncleared many used drinking glasses and empty wine bottles (which I'd left by the waste bin). A bottle cap dropped on the floor under the study desk was left lying there. In the late evening, the bellhop station at the driveway was unmanned, leaving me and my guests wondering how to call for taxis. I could have gotten a better hotel in a better location (Orchard Road) with better service for $20-30 more. Decidedly 3 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay - Recommended”
Reviews.Author: AudsnTim
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights - great location, could say the Best! Modern, very comfortable, great service and well worth the rate. Fast internet connection, (don't mind paying for service) good layout for one's computer too. Well stocked bar fridge, great lighting and wonderful bathroom supplies to indulge with. The only slight disappointment - there was no advertising information provided in the rooms to share location of gym, pool, dining hours etc. Truly recommended though - you will miss a fabulous opportunity if you don't try this hotel. We will surely stay next visit!!! Thanks to all the wonderful staff - they were always smiling and forever helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Mel1605
Reviews.Content: Hotel is new, pleasant and clean look. Internet is chargeable where it should be free for business travellers as it is an essential nowadays. Overall service was disappointing. A basic good morning and a basic smile is nowhere to be seen;from check-in to Zaffron restaurant. I was the one to initiate the greeting and there was no responce from the staff. I wondered is it that I am an Asian and that is why I was not getting the basic service. I noticed including the Europeans were also not given the basic treatment. For a 400+ rooms hotel, Zaffron restaurant seems to be a bit small to occupy all the guests if it is a full house. Service was utterly poor and disappointing. I entered the restaurant looking forward to enjoy my breakfast and it was immediately dampen by the hostess. When I greeted her she replied "May I have your key card?". I was not shown to my seat and had to figure out myself which table I can occupy. Breakfast spread was limited and unappetizing. I saw guests some guest had to SHARE table eventhough there are still empty seats avalable. Staff are very focus on their task (setting up for lunch) than providing a decent service to guests.

Reviews.Title: “1 minute away from Novena MRT station and Velocity Shopping Mall”
Reviews.Author: The_Holiday_Couple
Reviews.Content: Had a very good stay here. Some points to consider for people looking to choose this Hotel. Pros 1. Excellent and friendly staff 2. New Property so everything is new and fresh 3. Right next to the Novena MRT station (1 minute away) 4. Rooms are modern and comfortable 5. We had a infant with us and the staff was prompt to arrange a cot 6. Efficient and quick check-in and check-out 7. There are two huge shopping malls (one of which is called velocity) right above the MRT station and are adjacent to the Hotel (less than 1 minute away) Cons 1. Slightly away from where all the buzz is in the city (though still very convenient due to the proximity to the MRT station). Since we had a little baby with us and wanted to break out day into two halves with rest in the Hotel in between we thought it was slightly away and meant spending money on the MRT everytime. 2. No bath tub; which I thought was a shame for a 4 star Hotel Overall the excellent staff, comfortable room and the proximity to the shopping mall with loads of restaurants and to the MRT station makes this good choice. For people booking this, choose a room with the pool view and a higher floor than 11th as the other side only overlooks some construction and the MRT station.

Reviews.Title: “Oasia Oasis!”
Reviews.Author: AnnPerth
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Oasia during the Chinese National holidays. We spent 5 nights there for a mix of tourism and medical. So for us, the location was perfect. Pros: easy access to the MRT - only two stops to Orchard Rd - next to shops, restaurants and a food court - friendly staff - 24 gym - nice swimming pool - we had a special that included internet (but this may change quickly) - clean and tidy room with all necessary amenities - staff were very helpful with our check out, they gladly stored our luggage and allowed us to use the showers in the gym to refresh before our midnight flight Cons: you can hear the neighbors quite well; hairdryer and doors closing - no towels or sanitizing wipes in the gym - no plugs in the bathroom hence making hairdrying a tad awkward - initially the A/C was too cold but then we were told that there was an error with the installation and you had to adjust it opposite to what you want, eg. if it was too cold then you had to turn it to be colder - restaurant is too small for the hotel’s capacity, breakfast was really crowded - guest lifts are very slow The hotel has been open for only 5 months or so and of course will have teething problems. Overall we enjoyed the convenience of the location, the clean comfortable rooms and the friendly staff. I am sure this will become a very popular hotel. Tip: Tell taxi drivers that it is next to the ‘Novena Office Tower’. They all know that building.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: markmalina8899
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel in September we arrived early morning . We were met with a warm and efficient welcome, we were quickly checked in and shown to our room. We had a one bedroomed suite which was just fabulous, it was very big, clean and comfortable. What I particularly loved was the generous quantities of L'Ocitaine products we were spoilt with in the fabulous bathroom. The hotel iteself is well decorated and smells beautiful...a strong scent of fresh flowers greets you every time in the shiny reception lobby. The breakfast was good with a really good selection of various foods from all over the world, the service is in the restaurant was also very good. The pool was very nice and was generally very quiet when the children used it, every time we sat by the pool the attendant would provide us with clean towels, cold flannels to cool off, fresh water and fresch fruit to snack on, nothing was ever forgotten it was just great service all the way. My husband regularly used the hotel gym which he found well equipped and normally fairly quiet. Concierge services were helpful and knowledgeable and helped us to chose some interesting places to visit. We used room service and found the food and service very good. All in all we had a very good time and enjoyed staying in the hotel very much, we travel regularly and are fussy however we cannot fault this fabulous and friendly hotel. Thank you, It really is one of the best hotels we have ever stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Brand New Hotel in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: 4wdboy
Reviews.Content: here is a hotel that is very new and will only get better I believe with the passing weeks. nice clean rooms with all amenities that one wants one a business trip. could do with a better room service menu but you have many options in the mall right next door so its just a 1 min walk away. so is the MRT station which makes it very easy for your shopping trips to orchard road as well. taxi rides even during peak times to most central areas including CBD / orchard road etc just under SGD 15 including ERP costs.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem just two subway stops from Orchard Road”
Reviews.Author: frappeo
Reviews.Content: I had a very pleasant and enjoyable overnight stay at the newly opened Oasia Hotel right behind the Novena MRT Station, a five minute ride or two subway stops away from Orchard Road. The room was well appointed and designed along clean lines - like those you see in Ikea's catalogues. Sleep quality was excellent and I loved the blast from the shower. Internet, both wired and wifi, was great. I liked the hotel's infinity pool and the gym with brand new equipment. The in-room coffee machine saved me a morning trip to Starbucks in the adjoining Novena Square Shopping Mall (a suburban mall frequented by the office crowd at lunch and families at dinner) which has a well stocked supermarket on the ground floor. Signage is minimal as the hotel is new but it is not difficult to find my way around as everyone I met at the Oasia Hotel and its adjoining Novena Medical Centre II was very helpful, courteous and professional. I had a very nice three course dinner for just SGD20 (marinara pasta, cake and iced tea) at Doodles Pasta Bistro in the Oasia Hotel/NMC complex. The easiest way to get to Oasia Hotel from the Airport is by taxi if you are not familiar with Singapore's subway system. If you are, then take the train from Basement 2 of the Airport's Terminals 2,3, connect to the westbound train at Tanah Merah Station, and transfer to the northbound train at City Hall Interchange Station. The 40 minute journey costs peanuts at less than SGD2.00 compared with a taxi ride. From the Novena MRT Station, take the elevator which leads to an obscure but safe corridor in the Novena Square Mall, ride the escalator up one level and walk across the Novena Medical Centre I to reach Oasia Hotel - the building with a gray granite facade. I booked through a business associate with a corporate rate and paid a two star rate for a four star hotel with 4.5 star location. My only gripe - the overpowering scent of the air freshener on the ground floor of the Hotel/NMC. Booking through third party websites such as asiatravel.com will cost SGD214 (includes service and tax) for a night in a double or twin room which is up to 30% less than a night at a similar class downtown hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great new chic hotel”
Reviews.Author: getlucky
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel accidentally while on my way to the city in a cab (albeit looking at the sky). Decided to stay for a few nights during early September and I loved everything about it. Pro: Rooms are immaculately clean (as this is a new hotel), good amenities, the smell of their new towels are really fresh, free complimentary wifi on promotion, friendly staff, walking distance to Novena Square and MRT. AC in the room can get really cold even when you turn it off, I guess there is some sort of central air conditioning system. The hotel itself is new so taxi drivers may need directions to get there, just tell them it is right beside Novena Medical Centre, across from Tan Tock Seng Hospital, at the back of Novena Square. I didn't have the time to enjoy the pool nor the breakfast so can't comment much on them. I'd definitely come back due to my really positive experience. Kudos to Oasia and I hope the new pricing will stay reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Brand New and Minimalist”
Reviews.Author: ybobby
Reviews.Content: I was booked this hotel by the travel biro. As usual after got the hotel name, i check the review in trip advisor. And surprise.... at that time this hotel wasn't listed here. Then i tried the other sources like agoda, etc. And i had the answer, this is brand new hotel. This is interesting, because in my previous Singapore visit, I stayed in an old hotel that. Until the time i came there, yeah it is true. Everything new, the buidling, the room's property, etc. Even the taxi drivers was not recognized this place when i told them to take me to Oasia hotel. You will need additional detail like "Novena Square" or "near Novena MRT Station". In overall this hotel is pretty cool, comfort, near MRT station and shopping mall. The staff is friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Nice & Convenient”
Reviews.Author: my_xile
Reviews.Content: Good service, friendly staffs. Location was great! +-10mins walking distance to Novena MRT Station. Bed was comfortable, there's also an iPod dock in room.

Reviews.Title: “Value, Location and Brand New”
Reviews.Author: Alster2409
Reviews.Content: Brand new hotel, rooms are nice and modern with food facilities and amenities, huge TV and a smart capsule type coffee maker. Bathroom is cool (needs a hook for the bath robe is the only improvement needed) Bed was comfy and air conditioning efficient and quiet. The reception service was prompt and friendly. The location is great near a small shopping centre with all the essentials and a number of eating places and close to an MRT which will get you to Orchard and other areas very quickly! Overall for SIN as a combination of location price and amenities this was a very good place to stay and if the price remains competitive would stay there again. Recommend that the hotel offers free internet to seal the deal.

HotelInfo.Name: Oasia Hotel Singapore by Far East Hospitality
HotelInfo.Address: 8 Sinaran Drive, Singapore 307470, Singapore
